1MP.F.summary: Scana ASA, an industrial investment company, operates in the steel, valve control, offshore, property, and other businesses in Norway, South Korea, Sweden, China, the United States, Poland, Brazil, and Singapore. The company offers products, such as riser components for field development in very deep water. It also owns, develops, and manages properties. The company manages approximately 10,000 square meters of buildings, including smaller office buildings; manages properties and acreage in JÃ¸rpeland in Strand, east of Stavanger consisting of vacant land lots approximately 500 acres in size, as well as a cottage area that consists of approximately 20 plots near Liarvatn, northeast of JÃ¸rpeland; and owns and leases approximately 9,000 square meters of buildings in Volda primarily used for industry. In addition, it offers system solutions for offloading, mooring, turrets, and swivels for floating production and storage vessels; and hydraulic and pneumatic valve control systems for the oil, gas, and shipbuilding industries, including control panels, solenoid switches, hydraulic oil units, and/or PC/PLS-based systems for control and indication. The company was formerly known as Incus Investor ASA and changed its name to Scana ASA in May 2020. Scana ASA is based in Stavanger, Norway.

HPUR.OL.summary: Hexagon Purus Holding AS provides type 4 hydrogen high-pressure cylinders and cylinder systems, battery storage systems, and systems integration solutions for fuel cell and battery electric drivetrains. The company offers type 4 cylinders and cylinder systems for the storage of compressed hydrogen that is used primarily in mobility applications, such as medium- and heavy-duty trucks, buses, passenger vehicles, ferries, and trains. It also delivers hydrogen distribution modules and ultra-high pressure hydrogen ground storage systems for hydrogen refueling stations. In addition, it provides full drivetrain integration for medium- and heavy-duty commercial vehicles with alternative drivetrains comprising battery electric, fuel cell electric, and hybrids; and hydrogen cylinder systems and battery pack design and build for medium- and heavy-duty commercial vehicles with alternative drivetrains. The company offers hydrogen high-pressure vessels and systems for hydrogen light duty vehicles, infrastructure, distribution, rail, medium and heavy-duty vehicles, as well as for aerospace and aviation; and systems for battery electric vehicles and FCEVS for buses and battery packs. Hexagon Purus Holding AS was founded in 2017 and is headquartered in Alesund, Norway. Hexagon Purus Holding AS is a subsidiary of Hexagon Composites ASA.
